p: HIV-2 shares structural, antigenic, and genomic characteristics as HIV-1, although it shows a vastly different pathogenic ability in the human host [ 24]. HIV-2 has a lower infectivity, longer asymptomatic phase, and slower progression to AIDS than HIV-1 [ 25]. Like HIV-1, HIV-2 has a surface envelope glycoprotein that binds to co-receptor CD4, but at a lower affinity than HIV-1, possibly contributing to the differences seen between HIV-1 and HIV-2 [ 24].
